Description: Rim sherd of South Ionian pottery mug; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black (fired partly red) below; exterior: remains of decoration of lines at rim, reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The rim and interior slip find parallels with Samian Hera cups. However, unlike Hera cups which have dipinto dedications to the goddess, this cup has a graffito instead and the fabric is finer. Other similar cups were found in the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus and thus this shape is not exclusive to Hera. For parallels with Hera cups, see British Museum 1888,0601.401, 1888, 0601.402, 1888.0601.403, and 1888,0601.405. For parallels with a similar cup with a graffito inscription, see Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.227.1899.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.898) (Phase 3)
